intro: Melichrus, commonly known as the marsh clubmoss, is a genus of small, evergreen plants belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. These plants are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. They have a distinctive appearance with whorled leaves and small, cone-like structures called strobili. Melichrus species are characterized by their ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and their role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems. They are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their hardy nature and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
